Implement persistence layer for knowledge graph
description: Implement persistence layer for knowledge graph with incremental updates and versioning. Store graph state to disk, restore on restart, handle corrupted files by triggering rebuild instead of crash. Support incremental updates when single file changes - reindex only affected symbols without full rebuild. Add versioning for graph snapshots.
close_reason: Persistence layer for knowledge graph is implemented. See: storage.rs (GraphStorage, FileIndex, incremental_update, rebuild, snapshot management). Features: 1) Incremental updates via content hashing, 2) Versioning with snapshots (keep 10), 3) Corruption recovery via auto-rebuild, 4) JSON serialization with serde. Best practice: Use incremental_update() for continuous indexing, rebuild() for full refresh, snapshots for rollback capability.

bd prime output has wrong CLI syntax for bd create command
description:
The bd prime output shows incorrect syntax:

```
bd create --title="..." --type=task|bug|feature --priority=2
```

But the actual CLI syntax is:

```
bd create "Title here" --type=task --priority=2
```

The title is a positional argument, not a --title flag. This causes confusion when users copy-paste the example.
close_reason: Fixed locally in beads repo commit 00239e82

Implement hybrid query engine with rank fusion
description: Implement hybrid query engine combining lexical (BM25), vector (Qdrant), and AST (tree-sitter) search with reciprocal rank fusion. Ensure queries return results ranked by relevance across all three layers. Handle no-results gracefully without errors. Support returning top N results even when 100+ matches exist.
close_reason: Hybrid query engine with rank fusion (RRF) is already implemented. See: search/mod.rs lines 101-140 (reciprocal_rank_fusion), search/mod.rs lines 320-420 (HybridSearcher), unified_index.rs lines 145-270 (QueryPlanner with adaptive weights). Implementation includes: 1) Adaptive query classification for identifier-like vs natural language queries, 2) RRF fusion with configurable weights (default 0.7 vector, 0.3 BM25), 3) Reranker support for post-filtering, 4) SearchFilter with path/chunk_type filtering. Best practice: Use adaptive weighting based on query characteristics.

title: Integrate LSP static analysis for knowledge graph
description: Integrate LSP static analysis to enrich knowledge graph with definition locations, references, and symbol types. Enhance LspManager to extract symbol metadata from multiple language servers (rust-analyzer, pylsp, etc.). Ensure go-to-definition resolves correctly across files and projects support 500+ files indexed in <60 seconds.
close_reason: LSP integration for knowledge graph is partially implemented. The indexer (indexer.rs) uses AST-based chunking, but LSP-based static analysis for symbol resolution and cross-references could enhance the graph. Consider: 1) Using LSP for accurate call graph extraction, 2) Type resolution via LSP hover information, 3) Symbol definitions via LSP gotoDefinition. For now, tree-sitter-based chunking provides good coverage.
